Class AbstractRawClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uhn.hl7v2.hoh.raw.client.AbstractRawClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IClient
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HohRawClientMultithreaded, HohRawClientSimple

    public abstract class AbstractRawClient
extends Object
implements IClient

    • Field Summary

      The default connection timeout in milliseconds: 10000

      The default number of milliseconds to wait before timing out waiting for a response: 60000

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractRawClient

        public AbstractRawClient()
        Constructor

      • AbstractRawClient

        public AbstractRawClient(String theHost,
                         int thePort,
                         String thePath)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        theHost - The HOST (name/address). E.g. "192.168.1.1"
        thePort - The PORT. E.g. "8080"
        thePath - The path being requested (must either be blank or start with '/' and contain a path). E.g. "/Apps/Receiver.jsp"

      • AbstractRawClient

        public AbstractRawClient(URL theUrl)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        theUrl - The URL to connect to. Note that if the URL refers to the "https" protocol, a SocketFactory which uses TLS will be set. If custom certificates are used, a different factory may need to be provided manually.

      • getUriPath

        public String getUriPath()
        Description copied from interface: IClient
        Getter for the "Path" portion of the URL. This is the path portion which comes after the host and port, so for example if this client is being used to send messages to http://somehost.com:8888/messaging/receiver.jsp, the URI path portion would be /messaging/receiver.jsp
        Specified by:
        getUriPath in interface IClient

      • returnSocket

        protected abstract void returnSocket(Socket theSocket)
        Returns the socket provided by provideSocket(). This method will always be called after the request is finished.

      • sendAndReceive

        public IReceivable<String> sendAndReceive(ISendable<?> theMessageToSend)
                                   throws DecodeException,
                                          IOException,
                                          EncodeException
        Sends a message, waits for the response, and then returns the response if any
        Parameters:
        theMessageToSend - The message to send
        Returns:
        The returned message, as well as associated metadata
        Throws:
        DecodeException - If a problem occurs (read error, socket disconnect, etc.) during communication, or the response is invalid in some way. Note that IO errors in trying to connect to the remote host or sending the message are thrown directly (i.e. as IOException), but IO errors in reading the response are thrown as DecodeException
        IOException - If the client is unable to connect to the remote host
        EncodeException - If a failure occurs while encoding the message into a sendable HTTP request

      • setAuthorizationCallback

        public void setAuthorizationCallback(IAuthorizationClientCallback theAuthorizationCallback)
        Description copied from interface: IClient
        If set, provides a callback which will be used to se the username and password associated with the request
        Specified by:
        setAuthorizationCallback in interface IClient

      • setCharset

        public void setCharset(Charset theCharset)

        Sets the charset to use for requests from this client. May be changed at any time.

        Default is UTF-8

        Specified by:
        setCharset in interface IClient

        public void setSocketFactory(ISocketFactory theSocketFactory)

        See Also:

      • setUriPath

        public void setUriPath(String thePath)
        Setter for the "Path" portion of the URL. This is the path portion which comes after the host and port, so for example if this client is being used to send messages to http://somehost.com:8888/messaging/receiver.jsp, the URI path portion would be /messaging/receiver.jsp
        Specified by:
        setUriPath in interface IClient

      • setUrl

        public void setUrl(URL theUrl)
        Setter for the URL to send messages to. Note that invoking this method replaces any values that have been provided to IClient.setHost(String), IClient.setPort(int), or IClient.setUriPath(String)
        Specified by:
        setUrl in interface IClient

      • setUrlString

        public void setUrlString(String theString)
        Setter for the URL to send messages to. Note that invoking this method replaces any values that have been provided to IClient.setHost(String), IClient.setPort(int), or IClient.setUriPath(String)
        Specified by:
        setUrlString in interface IClient
